thread.title: Tegna, Dish spar over contract fees
thread.title_full: Tegna, Dish spar over contract fees

title: Tegna, Dish spar over contract fees
text:
Tegna, Dish spar over contract fees Associated Press | 
NEW YORK (AP) â€” TV station operator Tegna Inc. has cut off Dish Network subscribers' access to its local channels in more than three dozen markets because of a contract dispute between the two sides. 
At issue is that satellite broadcaster Dish refuses to pay the rate increase pushed by Tegna for retransmission consent fees. A new deal would allow the satellite broadcaster to continue carrying 46 television stations in 38 markets across 33 states operated by Tegna. 
Dish, based in Englewood, Colorado, released a statement late Friday saying it offered a short-term contract extension to Tegna while negotiations continued. Tegna, based in McLean, Virginia, said Dish routinely drops valued cable and broadcast channels and said it has always been able to reach a fair agreement with other providers without disrupting viewers.
